org.gilgamesh.model

Class Gilgamesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gilgamesh.model.Gilgamesh

  • public class Gilgamesh
extends Object
    The Gilgamesh core. This is the main class to manage AI data. You should create one of it for each context you have.
    Author:
    Eduardo Alevi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gilgamesh()
      Creates a new Gilgamesh instance.
      Gilgamesh(Memory memory)
      Creates a new Gilgamesh instance using a previous existing memory.

        public void fact(double force,
                 List<Atom<?>> values)

      • deduce

        public <T> Fact deduce(int deepLevel,
                       int answerChoice,
                       boolean matchAny,
                       boolean suppress,
                       T... values)
        Deduce an answer. This method goes through successively memory records in order to find a best answer according all informed parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic data type
        Parameters:
        deepLevel - How many times the code should go deep into the memory to find an answer.
        answerChoice - The order of choice which should be chosen among all records returned (negative values for mutation).
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        values - The question values be found.
        Returns:
        The closest deduced answer.

      • deduce

        public Fact deduce(int deepLevel,
                   int answerChoice,
                   boolean matchAny,
                   boolean suppress,
                   Atom<?>... values)
        Deduce an answer. This method goes through successively memory records in order to find a best answer according all informed parameters.
        Parameters:
        deepLevel - How many times the code should go deep into the memory to find an answer.
        answerChoice - The order of choice which should be chosen among all records returned (negative values for mutation).
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        values - The question values be found.
        Returns:
        The closest deduced answer.

      • deduce

        public Fact deduce(int deepLevel,
                   int answerChoice,
                   boolean matchAny,
                   boolean suppress,
                   Fact fact)
        Deduce an answer. This method goes through successively memory records in order to find a best answer according all informed parameters.
        Parameters:
        deepLevel - How many times the code should go deep into the memory to find an answer.
        answerChoice - The order of choice which should be chosen among all records returned (negative values for mutation).
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        fact - The question fact to be found.
        Returns:
        The closest deduced answer.

      • answer

        public Fact answer(Atom<?>... values)
        Return an single and most probable answer.
        Parameters:
        values - The question atoms you want to ask.
        Returns:
        The answer atoms.

      • answer

        public <T> Fact answer(T... values)
        Return an single and most probable answer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic data type
        Parameters:
        values - The question atoms you want to ask.
        Returns:
        The answer atoms.

      • answer

        public Fact answer(List<Atom<?>> values)
        Return an single and most probable answer.
        Parameters:
        values - A list of question atoms.
        Returns:
        The answer atoms, in the form of Answer class which contains the forces.

      • getAnswers

        public <T> TreeSet<Fact> getAnswers(boolean matchAny,
                                    boolean suppress,
                                    T... values)
        Get a list of answers for a question.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic data type
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        values - Question atoms.
        Returns:
        A list of Answer objects, containing the answers with their respective forces. The list is ordered from the most probable to the less probable.

      • getAnswers

        public TreeSet<Fact> getAnswers(boolean matchAny,
                                boolean suppress,
                                Atom<?>... values)
        Get a list of answers for a question.
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        values - Question atoms.
        Returns:
        A list of Answer objects, containing the answers with their respective forces. The list is ordered from the most probable to the less probable.

      • getAnswers

        public TreeSet<Fact> getAnswers(Predicate predicate,
                                List<Atom<?>> values)
        Returns a customized list of answers. If you want to customize the logic done by Gilgamesh, you can implement the Core inner class Predicate in order to provide your own matching implementation.
        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate object which will determine how to approve an answer.
        values - List of question atoms.
        Returns:
        A list of Answer objects, containing their respectives forces.

      • getAnswers

        public TreeSet<Fact> getAnswers(boolean matchAny,
                                boolean suppress,
                                List<Atom<?>> values)
        Get a list of answers for a question.
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should be combined, suppressing the atoms informed.
        matchAny - true if the answer should contains any question atoms. false if the answers should contains all question atoms.
        values - List of question atoms.
        Returns:
        A list of Answer objects, containing the answers with their respective forces. The list is ordered from the most probable to the less probable.

      • getAnswersEstimated

        public <T> TreeSet<Fact> getAnswersEstimated(boolean suppress,
                                             T... values)
        Get a list of answers for a question, using an estimation according Atom.equality() method. To have a estimated match between 0.0 and 1.0, all facts have to be informed using an custom Atom class, overriding the equality() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic data type
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        values - The question values
        Returns:
        the list of best estimated answers

      • getAnswersEstimated

        public TreeSet<Fact> getAnswersEstimated(boolean suppress,
                                         List<Atom<?>> values)
        Get a list of answers for a question, using an estimation according Atom.equality() method. To have a estimated match between 0.0 and 1.0, all facts have to be informed using an custom Atom class, overriding the equality() method.
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        values - The question values
        Returns:
        the list of best estimated answers

      • getAnswersEstimated

        public TreeSet<Fact> getAnswersEstimated(boolean suppress,
                                         Atom<?>... values)
        Get a list of answers for a question, using an estimation according Atom.equality() method. To have a estimated match between 0.0 and 1.0, all facts have to be informed using an custom Atom class, overriding the equality() method.
        Parameters:
        suppress - Indicates that answers should suppress question atoms.
        values - The question values
        Returns:
        the list of best estimated answers
